As the tank water level increases from 20 to 25 feet, the pump discharge pressure will __________; and the pump motor current will __________.

An air-cooled AC induction motor is initially operating at steady-state conditions, producing a work output of 50 hp. A reduction in cooling air flow rate to the motor causes the average stator winding temperature to increase by 20ºF. To maintain a 50 hp work output at the higher stator winding temperature, the voltage applied to the motor must be __________ because the stator winding resistance has __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020
The rate of heat production in the stator windings of an AC induction motor is __________ proportional to the __________ of the stator current.

KNOWLEDGE: K1.04 [2.7/2.8] QID: An axial flow ventilation fan is being driven by an AC motor. The fan is operating at 90 percent of rated flow rate with its discharge damper partially closed. How will the fan motor current change if its discharge damper is fully opened? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: The motor current will increase in accordance with the centrifugal pump laws.
choices.B: The motor current will increase, but not in accordance with the centrifugal pump laws.
choices.C: The motor current will decrease in accordance with the centrifugal pump laws.
choices.D: The motor current will decrease, but not in accordance with the centrifugal pump laws. -470- PWR Test Items

stem: Initially, an AC induction motor is operating with the following steady-state conditions: Motor current = 25 amps Average stator winding temperature = 140°F Ambient temperature = 90°F Assume the stator winding electrical resistance, motor heat transfer properties, and ambient temperature do not change. If a change in motor load causes the motor current to increase to 50 amps, which one of the following will be the new steady-state average stator winding temperature? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

Refer to the partial drawing of two identical centrifugal pumps in a cooling water system (see figure below). Each pump is driven by an identical three-phase AC induction motor. The cooling water system is being returned to service following maintenance on the pumps. Pump A was started five minutes ago to initiate flow in the cooling water system. Pump B is about to be started. When pump B is started, which one of the following will cause pump B to experience high starting current for a shorter time than usual before stabilizing at a lower running current? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Pump B is initially rotating in the reverse direction.
choices.B: The motor coupling for pump B was removed and not reinstalled.
choices.C: The packing gland for pump B was tightened since the pump last operated.
choices.D: The voltage applied to the motor for pump B is 20 percent lower than normal. -472- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the partial drawing of two identical single-speed radial-flow centrifugal pumps in a cooling water system (see figure below). Pumps 1 and 2 are driven by identical three-phase AC induction motors. Initially, pump 1 is operating normally and pump 2 is stopped. Then pump 2 is started, but its discharge check valve remains partially closed. When conditions stabilize, pump _____ will have the smaller motor current; and pump _____ will have the greater discharge head. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020
The starting current for a typical AC induction motor is usually much higher than the full-load running current because...

choices.A: starting torque is lower than full-load running torque.
choices.B: starting torque is higher than full-load running torque.
choices.C: rotor speed during start is too low to generate significant counter electromotive force in the stator.
choices.D: rotor current during start is too low to generate significant counter electromotive force in the stator.

stem: The average starting current for a typical AC induction motor is approximately... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: ten to fifteen times its normal running current.
choices.B: five to seven times its normal running current.
choices.C: two to three times its normal running current.
choices.D: the same as its normal running current. -474- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following describes the motor current indications that would be observed during the start of a large AC motor connected to a load?

choices.A: Amps slowly increase to the normal operating value over a period of five time constants.
choices.B: Amps immediately increase to the normal operating value and stabilize.
choices.C: Amps immediately increase to many times the normal operating value and then decrease to the normal operating value.
choices.D: Amps immediately increase to the full-scale value and then decrease rapidly to zero due to overload protection.

stem: If the discharge valve of a large motor-driven centrifugal pump is kept closed during a normal pump start, the current indication for the AC induction motor will rise to... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: approximately the full-load current value, and then decrease to the no-load current value.
choices.B: approximately the full-load current value, and then stabilize at the full-load current value.
choices.C: several times the full-load current value, and then decrease to the no-load current value.
choices.D: several times the full-load current value, and then decrease to the full-load value. -475- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following is a characteristic of a typical AC induction motor that causes starting current to be greater than running current?

choices.A: The rotor magnetic field induces an opposing voltage in the stator that is proportional to rotor speed.
choices.B: After the motor starts, resistors are added to the electrical circuit to limit the running current.
choices.C: A large amount of starting current is required to initially establish a rotating magnetic field.
choices.D: The rotor does not develop maximum induced current flow until it has achieved synchronous speed.

stem: The starting current in an AC motor is significantly higher than the full-load running current because... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: little counter electromotive force is induced in the rotor windings during motor start.
choices.B: motor torque production is highest during motor start.
choices.C: little counter electromotive force is induced in the stator windings during motor start.
choices.D: work performed by the motor is highest during motor start. -476- PWR Test Items

stem: Starting current in an AC induction motor is typically __________ times the full-load running current.

Which one of the following describes the motor current during the start of a typical motor-driven radial-flow centrifugal pump with a closed discharge valve? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Current immediately increases to the full-load value and then gradually decreases to the no-load value.
choices.B: Current immediately increases to the full-load value and then stabilizes at the full-load value.
choices.C: Current immediately increases to many times the full-load value and then rapidly decreases to the no-load value after several seconds and then stabilizes.
choices.D: Current immediately increases to many times the full-load value and then rapidly decreases to the full-load value after several seconds and then stabilizes. -477- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following describes the motor current indications that would be observed during the start of a large motor-driven radial-flow centrifugal pump with a closed discharge valve?

choices.A: Current immediately increases to the full-load value and then gradually decreases to the no-load value over several minutes.
choices.B: Current immediately increases to the no-load value and then stabilizes.
choices.C: Current immediately increases to many times the no-load value and then rapidly decreases to the no-load value after several seconds.
choices.D: Current immediately increases to many times the no-load value and then gradually decreases to the no-load value after several minutes.

stem: Two identical AC induction motors are connected to identical radial-flow centrifugal pumps being used to provide cooling water flow in separate systems in a nuclear power plant. Each motor is rated at 1,000 hp. The discharge valve for pump A is fully open and the discharge valve for pump B is fully shut. Each pump is currently off. If the pumps are started under these conditions, the longer time period required to stabilize motor current will be experienced by the motor for pump _____; and the higher stable motor current will be experienced by the motor for pump _____. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020
Which one of the following describes when the highest stator current will be experienced by an AC induction motor?

choices.A: During motor operation at full load.
choices.B: During motor operation at zero load.

stem: Two identical AC induction motors are connected to identical radial-flow centrifugal pumps in identical but separate cooling water systems. Each motor is rated at 200 hp. The discharge valve for pump A is fully shut and the discharge valve for pump B is fully open. Each pump is currently off. If the pumps are started under these conditions, the longer time period required to stabilize motor current will be experienced by the motor for pump _____; and the higher stable motor current will be experienced by the motor for pump _____. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

Two identical AC induction motors are connected to identical radial-flow centrifugal pumps in identical but separate cooling water systems. Each motor is rated at 200 hp. The discharge valve for pump A is fully shut and the discharge valve for pump B is fully open. Each pump is currently off. If the pumps are started under these conditions, the shorter time period required to reach a stable running current will be experienced by the motor for pump _____; and the higher stable running current will be experienced by the motor for pump _____.

To minimize the duration of high starting current, an AC induction motor should be started __________ to __________ the stator counter electromotive force. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: partially loaded; delay -480- PWR Test Items

stem: Two identical AC induction motors are connected to identical radial-flow centrifugal pumps in identical but separate cooling water systems. Each motor is rated at 200 hp. The discharge valve for pump A is fully open and the discharge valve for pump B is fully closed. Each pump is currently off. If the pumps are started under these conditions, the shorter time period required to reach a stable running current will be experienced by the motor for pump _____; and the higher stable running current will be experienced by the motor for pump _____.
What is the primary reason for limiting the number of starts for an electric motor in a given period of time? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Prevent overheating of the windings due to high starting currents.
choices.B: Prevent overheating of the windings due to shorting within the stator.
choices.C: Prevent rotor damage due to excessive cyclic stresses on the shaft.
choices.D: Prevent rotor damage due to excessive axial displacement of the shaft. -481- PWR Test Items

stem: The frequency of starts for large AC motors should be limited to prevent excessive...

choices.C: torsional stresses on the motor shaft.
choices.D: arcing and degradation of motor breaker contacts.

stem: The number of starts for an electric motor in a given period of time should be limited because overheating of the __________ can occur due to the __________ counter electromotive force produced at low rotor speeds. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: commutator and/or slip rings; high -482- PWR Test Items

stem: The frequency of start/stop cycles for an electrical motor is limited to prevent...

choices.D: excessive cycling of the motor breaker.

stem: Frequent starts of large motors will result in overheating of the motor windings due to high current flow caused by... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: low electrical resistance of the motor windings.
choices.B: an electrical short circuit between the rotor and stator.
choices.C: high counter electromotive force at low rotor speeds.
choices.D: windage losses between the rotor and stator. -483- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following is the primary reason for limiting the number of motor starts in a given time period?

choices.A: Minimizes pitting of contacts in the motor breaker.
choices.B: Prevents excessive torsional stresses on the motor shaft.
choices.C: Prevents overheating of the motor windings.
choices.D: Minimizes axial stresses on the motor bearings.

stem: A large centrifugal pump is driven by a 200 horsepower AC induction motor. The motor breaker control circuit contains the following protection devices: instantaneous overcurrent relay, motor thermal overload relay, control power fuses, and an anti-pumping device. The pump had been manually started and stopped several times during a 5 minute period when the motor breaker tripped. Which one of the following is the most likely cause of the breaker trip? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Anti-pumping device actuation. -484- PWR Test Items
